core_definition.goal: Create and deliver strategic intellectual property, scale expertise
core_definition.pain: Knowledge lives in brain, hard to capture and transfer, AI can't replace strategic thinking
core_definition.success: Team can access and apply expertise without bottlenecking through SME

why_this_persona_matters.note: This persona represents knowledge workers whose value is HARD TO AUTOMATE. They see AI as a 'starting point' for execution, not a replacement for strategic thinking. They are skeptical of overpromised AI capabilities but open to tools that amplify (not replace) their expertise.
why_this_persona_matters.evaluation_focus: Can this capture my brain dumps efficiently?

ai_adoption_stage.note: Higher skeptic ratio - they don't believe AI can replace strategic thinking

typical_pain_points: Knowledge lives in my brain, not in systems
Team wants to scale my expertise but can't clone me
Impromptu strategy sessions don't get properly captured
AI outputs are just the 'base' - I add the strategic value
Context from past conversations doesn't transfer to team
Strategic recommendations are different from 'what the client said they wanted'
typical_fears: AI will produce generic output that misses strategic nuance
Team will rely on AI summaries instead of strategic thinking
Automation will reduce the perceived value of my expertise
Tool will oversimplify complex strategic decisions
My unique insights will get averaged away
typical_voice_quotes: A lot of the insights are coming from strategic recommendations, not just what the client said they wanted... That's coming from my brain.
I'm doing impromptu Zoom with people to talk about strategy stuff that comes up really quickly.
I'm open to trying it. I'm not sure... a lot of the insights are coming from strategic recommendations.
I'm an AI evangelist. I'm a huge data nerd. Comic books, data, and chocolate bars. That's my thing.
I like to know things, be prepared, and also help plan for GTM.
Understanding the technical side of what a project might entail... making sure we have enough information to create a build plan.

behavioral_patterns.first_click_tendency: Looks for how to extract insights from their conversations
behavioral_patterns.error_response: Critiques AI output and improves it manually
behavioral_patterns.abandonment_trigger: AI produces generic output without strategic depth
behavioral_patterns.evaluation_style: Quality-focused, tests whether AI captures nuance

ai_relationship.view_of_ai: AI as starting point, not replacement
ai_relationship.expected_value: Capture and organize my thinking, don't try to replicate it
evaluation_criteria: Does it preserve the nuance of my strategic recommendations?
Can my team access context without asking me?
Does it make my expertise more scalable?

real_customer_examples.name: Hannah Keeling
real_customer_examples.key_trait: Knowledge worker whose brain is the product

real_customer_examples.name: Richard Walsh
real_customer_examples.key_trait: AI evangelist with 25 years agency experience
real_customer_examples.quote: I'm an AI evangelist. I'm a huge data nerd.
